instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
threads.message:
Good morning, everyone.

I received this MacBook for repair; it turns on but doesn't charge. The USB-C ports weren't working, and the AMP meter is cycling.

After inspecting the logic board, I found that <CAPACITOR>C5202</CAPACITOR> was blown, and <SIGNAL>PDCIN_AON_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> was shorted. I replaced the capacitor, and now it gets 20V and 1.8 amps on the USB-C ports.

However, the problem is that when I disconnect the charger and connect it back again, it stops charging and goes to 20V 0.03 amps. The only way to make it work again is to disconnect the battery and connect it back.

I tested it with another battery, and the issue remains the same. I replaced the <CHIP>U5200</CHIP> (ISL9240HI), but it made no difference.

Could someone please provide some guidance?

Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
threads.message:
So battery is charging at the beginning?
Did you test flipping charger cable on all ports?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
threads.message:
Yes, battery charges at the beginning after connecting the battery. If I disconnect the charger and plug it back, the battery stops to charge.
Yes, both ports on both charger side are same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
threads.message:
When stopped charging, battery percentage is recognized correctly at least?

Check resistance over <CAPACITOR>C5220</CAPACITOR>/60, in ohm scale.
Install HWMonitor and look for strange I/V sensors value.

Also check <TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR>/70 voltages, in working and non-working conditions.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
threads.message:
Yes, it still shows the battery percentage after it stop to work.
Just realise that after it stop charging just by restarting the mac it starts to recognize the charger and charge again.

While it is charging.
<TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR> – 12.23V
<TRANSISTOR>Q5270</TRANSISTOR> – <SIGNAL>SAVE_BAT_G</SIGNAL> - 5.60V
            – <SIGNAL>SAVE_BAT_S</SIGNAL> - 4.91V
            - <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON_CONN</SIGNAL> - 12.23V

While it is not charging.
<TRANSISTOR>Q5265</TRANSISTOR> – 12.23V
<TRANSISTOR>Q5270</TRANSISTOR> – <SIGNAL>SAVE_BAT_G</SIGNAL> - 5.58V
            – <SIGNAL>SAVE_BAT_S</SIGNAL> - 4.87V
            - <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_AON_CONN</SIGNAL> - 11.42V

<CAPACITOR>C5220</CAPACITOR> - 134ohm
<CAPACITOR>C5260</CAPACITOR> - 130ohm rising

Regard the HWMonitor I could not find it for Mac.
What is I/V sensors?
Can I use TG Pro to check these sensors?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
threads.message:
"<CAPACITOR>C5220</CAPACITOR> - 134ohm
<CAPACITOR>C5260</CAPACITOR> - 130ohm rising"
Must be both 2 ohm, as per schematic.
Check <RESISTOR>R5221</RESISTOR>/2 and <RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR>/2.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR> faulty.
Replaced and now the Mac is dead. :ROFLMAO:
5V 0.04amp

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> – Powers on but not charging. USB-C ports dead.
threads.message:
You must get 2 ohm over <CAPACITOR>C5260</CAPACITOR> too.
<RESISTOR>R5222</RESISTOR> can't correct that; check <RESISTOR>R5261</RESISTOR>/2.
